function.name: normalize-space

description.p: Returns a copy of the source string with leading and trailing space removed, as well as compressing runs of whitespace characters into a single space.

function.example: normalize-space(' a little tiny space ') returns: a little tiny space

description.p: Convert the condition expression to either true() or false().
An empty string, an empty nodeset or the number 0 returns false(), anything else returns true().
description.note: Watch out for these pitfalls: ALL of these return true() when used in an expression that expects a boolean result, e.g., in the test attribute of a when or an if element: "1", "0", "true", "false"

description.p: Returns a node set of all the nodes in the name index, with the value value stored. Used in conjunction with the key element to facilitate fast and easy lookups in the source XML.

If the nodes in your document has a unique ID attribute (defined in the DOCTYPE), you can use the id function to select them with. The ids argument takes a whitespace separated string of IDs or a nodeset to take values from, and returns a nodeset containing all of the nodes referenced by their IDs.

pre.code:
<!-- Grab three specific nodes by their IDs --> <xsl:variable name="static" select="id('4815 1623 4200')" />
<!-- Grab any node referenced in a `<nodeId>` child --> <xsl:variable name="dynamic" select="id(nodeId)" />
